definition: a neglected branch (of arts, science, sports etc)/fig. a complete unknown who wins a competition

gate/door/CL:扇[shan4]/gateway/doorway/CL:個|个[ge4]/opening/valve/switch/way to do something/knack/family/house/(religious) sect/school (of thought)/class/category/phylum or division (taxonomy)/classifier for large guns/classifier for lessons, subjects, branches of technology/(suffix) -gate (i.e. scandal; derived from Watergate)
an upset (esp. in sports)/unexpected turn of events/to pull off a coup/a breakthrough
erhua variant of 爆冷門|爆冷门[bao4 leng3 men2]

sentences.english: Way too often what is hot this year won't be hot a few years from now.
sentences.chinese: 今年熱門的行業幾年後很可能會成冷門，這是常事。

sentences.english: However, it wasn't until the fourth ever World Cup that the first upset occured.
sentences.chinese: 然而，直到第四屆世界盃纔出現了第一個真正的冷門。

sentences.english: There was almost an upset in the finals of the men's floor exercise.
sentences.chinese: 男子自由體操決賽幾乎爆出冷門。

sentences.english: The winning horse was a rank outsider.
sentences.chinese: 獲勝的馬是一匹完全不起眼兒的冷門馬。

sentences.english: This year's Gold Horse Award had a really unexpected winner.
sentences.chinese: 今年的金馬獎爆了個大冷門。

sentences.english: There were many unexpected results during the World Shortcourse Swimming Championships in Sweden .
sentences.chinese: 在瑞典舉行的世界短池游泳錦標賽中爆出了許多冷門。

definition: minority of the population/non-mainstream (activity, pursuit etc)/niche (market etc)
rare/not familiar (to the speaker)/sth rarely experience/hard to see
to be partial towards sth/to favor/to prefer/preference/favorite
only/merely/no more than/but/however/anyway (to get back to a previous topic)/cannot be more (after adjectival)
in those days/then/in those years/during that time
